verses.verse: Then <WG2532> came together <WG4863> unto <WG4314> him <WG846> the Pharisees <WG5330>, and <WG2532> certain <WG5100> of the scribes <WG1122>, which came <WG2064> from <WG575> Jerusalem <WG2414>.

And <WG2532> when they saw <WG1492> some <WG5100> of his <WG846> disciples <WG3101> eat <WG2068> bread <WG740> with defiled <WG2839>, that is to say <WG5123>, with unwashen <WG449>, hands <WG5495>, they found fault <WG3201>. defiled: or, common

For <WG1063> the Pharisees <WG5330>, and <WG2532> all <WG3956> the Jews <WG2453>, except <WG3362> they wash <WG3538> their hands <WG5495> oft <WG4435>, eat <WG2068> not <WG3756>, holding <WG2902> the tradition <WG3862> of the elders <WG4245>. oft: or, diligently: in the original, with the fist: Theophylact, up to the elbow

And <WG2532> when they come from <WG575> the market <WG58>, except <WG3362> they wash <WG907>, they eat <WG2068> not <WG3756>. And <WG2532> many <WG4183> other things <WG243> there be <WG2076>, which <WG3739> they have received <WG3880> to hold <WG2902>, as the washing <WG909> of cups <WG4221>, and <WG2532> pots <WG3582>, <WG2532> brasen vessels <WG5473>, and <WG2532> of tables <WG2825>. pots: sextarius is about a pint and an half tables: or, beds

Then <WG1899> the Pharisees <WG5330> and <WG2532> scribes <WG1122> asked <WG1905> him <WG846>, Why <WG1302> walk <WG4043> not <WG3756> thy <WG4675> disciples <WG3101> according <WG2596> to the tradition <WG3862> of the elders <WG4245>, but <WG235> eat <WG2068> bread <WG740> with unwashen <WG449> hands <WG5495>?

He answered <WG611> and <WG1161> said <WG2036> unto them <WG846>, <WG3754> Well <WG2573> hath Esaias <WG2268> prophesied <WG4395> of <WG4012> you <WG5216> hypocrites <WG5273>, as <WG5613> it is written <WG1125>, This <WG3778> people <WG2992> honoureth <WG5091> me <WG3165> with their lips <WG5491>, but <WG1161> their <WG846> heart <WG2588> is <WG568> far <WG4206> from <WG575> me <WG1700>.
Howbeit <WG1161> in vain <WG3155> do they worship <WG4576> me <WG3165>, teaching <WG1321> for doctrines <WG1319> the commandments <WG1778> of men <WG444>.

For <WG1063> laying aside <WG863> the commandment <WG1785> of God <WG2316>, ye hold <WG2902> the tradition <WG3862> of men <WG444>, as the washing <WG909> of pots <WG3582> and <WG2532> cups <WG4221>: and <WG2532> many <WG4183> other <WG243> such <WG5108> like things <WG3946> ye do <WG4160>.

And <WG2532> he said <WG3004> unto them <WG846>, Full well <WG2573> ye reject <WG114> the commandment <WG1785> of God <WG2316>, that <WG2443> ye may keep <WG5083> your own <WG5216> tradition <WG3862>. reject: or, frustrate

For <WG1063> Moses <WG3475> said <WG2036>, Honour <WG5091> thy <WG4675> father <WG3962> and <WG2532> thy <WG4675> mother <WG3384>; and <WG2532>, Whoso curseth <WG2551> father <WG3962> or <WG2228> mother <WG3384>, let him die <WG5053> the death <WG2288>:

But <WG1161> ye <WG5210> say <WG3004>, If <WG1437> a man <WG444> shall say <WG2036> to his father <WG3962> or <WG2228> mother <WG3384>, It is Corban <WG2878>, that is to say <WG3603>, a gift <WG1435>, by <WG1537> whatsoever <WG3739> <WG1437> thou mightest be profited by <WG5623> me <WG1700>; he shall be free.
And <WG2532> ye suffer <WG863> him <WG846> no more <WG3765> to do <WG4160> ought <WG3762> for his <WG846> father <WG3962> or <WG2228> his <WG846> mother <WG3384>;

Making <WG208> the word <WG3056> of God <WG2316> of none effect <WG208> through your <WG5216> tradition <WG3862>, which <WG3739> ye have delivered <WG3860>: and <WG2532> many <WG4183> such <WG5108> like things <WG3946> do ye <WG4160>.

And <WG2532> when he had called <WG4341> all <WG3956> the people <WG3793> unto him, he said <WG3004> unto them <WG846>, Hearken <WG191> unto me <WG3450> every one <WG3956> of you, and <WG2532> understand <WG4920>:

There is <WG2076> nothing <WG3762> from without <WG1855> a man <WG444>, that <WG3739> entering <WG1531> into <WG1519> him <WG846> can <WG1410> defile <WG2840> him <WG846>: but <WG235> the things which come <WG1607> out of <WG575> him <WG846>, those <WG1565> are they <WG2076> that defile <WG2840> the man <WG444>.
If any man <WG1536> have <WG2192> ears <WG3775> to hear <WG191>, let him hear <WG191>.

And <WG2532> when <WG3753> he was entered <WG1525> into <WG1519> the house <WG3624> from <WG575> the people <WG3793>, his <WG846> disciples <WG3101> asked <WG1905> him <WG846> concerning <WG4012> the parable <WG3850>.

And <WG2532> he saith <WG3004> unto them <WG846>, Are <WG2075> ye <WG5210> so <WG3779> without understanding <WG801> also <WG2532>? Do ye <WG3539> not <WG3756> perceive <WG3539>, that <WG3754> whatsoever thing <WG3956> from without <WG1855> entereth <WG1531> into <WG1519> the man <WG444>, it cannot <WG3756> <WG1410> defile <WG2840> him <WG846>;

Because <WG3754> it entereth <WG1531> not <WG3756> into <WG1519> his <WG846> heart <WG2588>, but <WG235> into <WG1519> the belly <WG2836>, and <WG2532> goeth out <WG1607> into <WG1519> the draught <WG856>, purging <WG2511> all <WG3956> meats <WG1033>?
And <WG1161> he said <WG3004>, <WG3754> That which cometh <WG1607> out of <WG1537> the man <WG444>, that <WG1565> defileth <WG2840> the man <WG444>.
For <WG1063> from within <WG2081>, out of <WG1537> the heart <WG2588> of men <WG444>, proceed <WG1607> evil <WG2556> thoughts <WG1261>, adulteries <WG3430>, fornications <WG4202>, murders <WG5408>,

Thefts <WG2829>, covetousness <WG4124>, wickedness <WG4189>, deceit <WG1388>, lasciviousness <WG766>, an evil <WG4190> eye <WG3788>, blasphemy <WG988>, pride <WG5243>, foolishness <WG877>: covetousness: Gr. covetousnesses, wickednesses
All <WG3956> these <WG5023> evil things <WG4190> come <WG1607> from within <WG2081>, and <WG2532> defile <WG2840> the man <WG444>.

And <WG2532> from thence <WG1564> he arose <WG450>, and went <WG565> into <WG1519> the borders <WG3181> of Tyre <WG5184> and <WG2532> Sidon <WG4605>, and <WG2532> entered <WG1525> into <WG1519> an house <WG3614>, and would have <WG2309> no man <WG3762> know <WG1097> it: but <WG2532> he could <WG1410> not <WG3756> be hid <WG2990>.

For <WG1063> a certain woman <WG1135>, whose <WG3739> <WG846> young daughter <WG2365> had <WG2192> an unclean <WG169> spirit <WG4151>, heard <WG191> of <WG4012> him <WG846>, and came <WG2064> and fell <WG4363> at <WG4314> his <WG846> feet <WG4228>:

<WG1161> The woman <WG1135> was <WG2258> a Greek <WG1674>, a Syrophenician <WG4949> by nation <WG1085>; and <WG2532> she besought <WG2065> him <WG846> that <WG2443> he would cast forth <WG1544> the devil <WG1140> out of <WG1537> her <WG846> daughter <WG2364>. Greek: or, Gentile Greek: or, Gentile

But <WG1161> Jesus <WG2424> said <WG2036> unto her <WG846>, Let <WG863> the children <WG5043> first <WG4412> be filled <WG5526>: for <WG1063> it is <WG2076> not <WG3756> meet <WG2570> to take <WG2983> the children's <WG5043> bread <WG740>, and <WG2532> to cast <WG906> it unto the dogs <WG2952>.

And <WG1161> she answered <WG611> and <WG2532> said <WG3004> unto him <WG846>, Yes <WG3483>, Lord <WG2962>: yet <WG2532> <WG1063> the dogs <WG2952> under <WG5270> the table <WG5132> eat <WG2068> of <WG575> the children's <WG3813> crumbs <WG5589>.
And <WG2532> he said <WG2036> unto her <WG846>, For <WG1223> this <WG5126> saying <WG3056> go thy way <WG5217>; the devil <WG1140> is gone <WG1831> out of <WG1537> thy <WG4675> daughter <WG2364>.

And <WG2532> when she was come <WG565> to <WG1519> her <WG846> house <WG3624>, she found <WG2147> the devil <WG1140> gone out <WG1831>, and <WG2532> her daughter <WG2364> laid <WG906> upon <WG1909> the bed <WG2825>.

And <WG2532> again <WG3825>, departing <WG1831> from <WG1537> the coasts <WG3725> of Tyre <WG5184> and <WG2532> Sidon <WG4605>, he came <WG2064> unto <WG4314> the sea <WG2281> of Galilee <WG1056>, through <WG303> the midst <WG3319> of the coasts <WG3725> of Decapolis <WG1179>.

And <WG2532> they bring <WG5342> unto him <WG846> one that was deaf <WG2974>, and had an impediment in his speech <WG3424>; and <WG2532> they beseech <WG3870> him <WG846> to <WG2443> put <WG2007> his hand <WG5495> upon him <WG846>.

And <WG2532> he took <WG618> him <WG846> aside <WG2596> <WG2398> from <WG575> the multitude <WG3793>, and put <WG906> his <WG846> fingers <WG1147> into <WG1519> his <WG846> ears <WG3775>, and <WG2532> he spit <WG4429>, and touched <WG680> his <WG846> tongue <WG1100>;
And <WG2532> looking up <WG308> to <WG1519> heaven <WG3772>, he sighed <WG4727>, and <WG2532> saith <WG3004> unto him <WG846>, Ephphatha <WG2188>, that is <WG3603>, Be opened <WG1272>.

And <WG2532> straightway <WG2112> his <WG846> ears <WG189> were opened <WG1272>, and <WG2532> the string <WG1199> of his <WG846> tongue <WG1100> was loosed <WG3089>, and <WG2532> he spake <WG2980> plain <WG3723>.

And <WG2532> he charged <WG1291> them <WG846> that <WG2443> they should tell <WG2036> no man <WG3367>: but <WG1161> the more <WG3745> he <WG846> charged <WG1291> them <WG846>, so much the more <WG3123> a great deal <WG4054> they published <WG2784> it;

And <WG2532> were beyond measure <WG5249> astonished <WG1605>, saying <WG3004>, He hath done <WG4160> all things <WG3956> well <WG2573>: he maketh <WG4160> both <WG2532> the deaf <WG2974> to hear <WG191>, and <WG2532> the dumb <WG216> to speak <WG2980>.
